megadepth 0.99.8
  • Get started
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Run Megadepth commands

Source: R/megadepth.R
megadepth_cmd.Rd

Wrapper functions to run Megadepth commands via system2('megadepth', ...).

megadepth_cmd(...)

megadepth_shell(input = ".", ...)

Arguments

...

Arguments to be passed to system2('megadepth', ...), e.g. annotation(path) is basically megadepth_cmd(c('--annotation', path)) (i.e. run the command megadepth --annotation path).
input

A character(1) with the path to the input BAM, BigWig or text file for Megadepth.

Value

See base::system2() for the types of output you can generate.

A character() with the capture of the standard output stream generated by Megadepth.

Functions

  • megadepth_cmd: Run an arbitrary Megadepth command.

  • megadepth_shell: Run an arbitrary Megadepth command.

References

megadepth_cmd() is based on blogdown::hugo_cmd() which is available at https://github.com/rstudio/blogdown/blob/master/R/hugo.R.

megadepth_shell() is based on the shell_ls() example from cmdfun which is available at https://snystrom.github.io/cmdfun/index.html.

Examples


## Install if necessary
install_megadepth()

#> The latest megadepth version is 1.0.6
#> megadepth has been installed to /github/home/bin

## Find version
## megadepth_shell() provides an interface more familiar to R users
megadepth_shell(version = TRUE)

#> [1] "megadepth 1.0.6"
## megadepth_cmd() requires using directly the command line syntax for
## Megadepth
megadepth_cmd("--version", stdout = TRUE)

#> [1] "megadepth 1.0.6"

## Compare the help files:
# megadepth_shell() captures the standard output and returns a character()
# megadepth_cmd() shows the standard output on the console
megadepth_shell("--help")

#>  [1] "megadepth 1.0.6"                                                                                                                                           
#>  [2] ""                                                                                                                                                          
#>  [3] "BAM and BigWig utility."                                                                                                                                   
#>  [4] ""                                                                                                                                                          
#>  [5] "Usage:"                                                                                                                                                    
#>  [6] "  megadepth <bam|bw|-> [options]"                                                                                                                          
#>  [7] ""                                                                                                                                                          
#>  [8] "Options:"                                                                                                                                                  
#>  [9] "  -h --help                Show this screen."                                                                                                              
#> [10] "  --version                Show version."                                                                                                                  
#> [11] "  --threads                # of threads to do: BAM decompression OR compute sums over multiple BigWigs in parallel"                                        
#> [12] "                            if the 2nd is intended then a TXT file listing the paths to the BigWigs to process in parallel"                                
#> [13] "                            should be passed in as the main input file instead of a single BigWig file (EXPERIMENTAL)."                                    
#> [14] "  --prefix                 String to use to prefix all output files."                                                                                      
#> [15] "  --no-auc-stdout          Force all AUC(s) to be written to <prefix>.auc.tsv rather than STDOUT"                                                          
#> [16] "  --no-annotation-stdout   Force summarized annotation regions to be written to <prefix>.annotation.tsv rather than STDOUT"                                
#> [17] "  --no-coverage-stdout     Force covered regions to be written to <prefix>.coverage.tsv rather than STDOUT"                                                
#> [18] "  --keep-order             Output annotation coverage in the order chromosomes appear in the BAM/BigWig file"                                              
#> [19] "                           The default is to output annotation coverage in the order chromosomes appear in the annotation BED file."                       
#> [20] "                           This is only applicable if --annotation is used for either BAM or BigWig input."                                                
#> [21] ""                                                                                                                                                          
#> [22] "BigWig Input:"                                                                                                                                             
#> [23] "Extract regions and their counts from a BigWig outputting BED format if a BigWig file is detected as input (exclusive of the other BAM modes):"            
#> [24] "                                          Extracts all reads from the passed in BigWig and output as BED format."                                          
#> [25] "                                           This will also report the AUC over the annotated regions to STDOUT."                                            
#> [26] "                                           If only the name of the BigWig file is passed in with no other args, it will *only* report total AUC to STDOUT."
#> [27] "  --annotation <bed>                      Only output the regions in this BED applying the argument to --op to them."                                      
#> [28] "  --op <sum[default], mean, min, max>     Statistic to run on the intervals provided by --annotation"                                                      
#> [29] "  --sums-only                             Discard coordinates from output of summarized regions"                                                           
#> [30] "  --bwbuffer <1GB[default]>               Size of buffer for reading BigWig files, critical to use a large value (~1GB) for remote BigWigs."               
#> [31] "                                           Default setting should be fine for most uses, but raise if very slow on a remote BigWig."                       
#> [32] ""                                                                                                                                                          
#> [33] ""                                                                                                                                                          
#> [34] "BAM Input:"                                                                                                                                                
#> [35] "Extract basic junction information from the BAM, including co-occurrence"                                                                                  
#> [36] "If only the name of the BAM file is passed in with no other args, it will *only* report total AUC to STDOUT."                                              
#> [37] "  --junctions          Extract jx coordinates, strand, and anchor length, per read"                                                                        
#> [38] "                       writes to a TSV file <prefix>.jxs.tsv"                                                                                              
#> [39] "  --longreads          Modifies certain buffer sizes to accommodate longer reads such as PB/Oxford."                                                       
#> [40] "  --filter-in          Integer bitmask, any bits of which alignments need to have to be kept (similar to samtools view -f)."                               
#> [41] "  --filter-out         Integer bitmask, any bits of which alignments need to have to be skipped (similar to samtools view -F)."                            
#> [42] ""                                                                                                                                                          
#> [43] "Non-reference summaries:"                                                                                                                                  
#> [44] "  --alts                       Print differing from ref per-base coverages"                                                                                
#> [45] "                               Writes to a CSV file <prefix>.alts.tsv"                                                                                     
#> [46] "  --include-softclip           Print a record to the alts CSV for soft-clipped bases"                                                                      
#> [47] "                               Writes total counts to a separate TSV file <prefix>.softclip.tsv"                                                           
#> [48] "  --only-polya                 If --include-softclip, only print softclips which are mostly A's or T's"                                                    
#> [49] "  --include-n                  Print mismatch records when mismatched read base is N"                                                                      
#> [50] "  --print-qual                 Print quality values for mismatched bases"                                                                                  
#> [51] "  --delta                      Print POS field as +/- delta from previous"                                                                                 
#> [52] "  --require-mdz                Quit with error unless MD:Z field exists everywhere it's"                                                                   
#> [53] "                               expected"                                                                                                                   
#> [54] "  --head                       Print sequence names and lengths in SAM/BAM header"                                                                         
#> [55] ""                                                                                                                                                          
#> [56] "Coverage and quantification:"                                                                                                                              
#> [57] "  --coverage           Print per-base coverage (slow but totally worth it)"                                                                                
#> [58] "  --auc                Print per-base area-under-coverage, will generate it for the genome"                                                                
#> [59] "                       and for the annotation if --annotation is also passed in"                                                                           
#> [60] "                       Defaults to STDOUT, unless other params are passed in as well, then"                                                                
#> [61] "                       if writes to a TSV file <prefix>.auc.tsv"                                                                                           
#> [62] "  --bigwig             Output coverage as BigWig file(s).  Writes to <prefix>.bw"                                                                          
#> [63] "                       (also <prefix>.unique.bw when --min-unique-qual is specified)."                                                                     
#> [64] "                       Requires libBigWig."                                                                                                                
#> [65] "  --annotation <bed>   Path to BED file containing list of regions to sum coverage over"                                                                   
#> [66] "                       (tab-delimited: chrm,start,end)"                                                                                                    
#> [67] "  --op <sum[default], mean>     Statistic to run on the intervals provided by --annotation"                                                                
#> [68] "  --min-unique-qual <int>"                                                                                                                                 
#> [69] "                       Output second bigWig consisting built only from alignments"                                                                         
#> [70] "                       with at least this mapping quality.  --bigwig must be specified."                                                                   
#> [71] "                       Also produces second set of annotation sums based on this coverage"                                                                 
#> [72] "                       if --annotation is enabled"                                                                                                         
#> [73] "  --double-count       Allow overlapping ends of PE read to count twice toward"                                                                            
#> [74] "                       coverage"                                                                                                                           
#> [75] "  --num-bases          Report total sum of bases in alignments processed (that pass filters)"                                                              
#> [76] "  --gzip               Turns on gzipping of coverage output (no effect if --bigwig is passsed),"                                                           
#> [77] "                       this will also enable --no-coverage-stdout."                                                                                        
#> [78] ""                                                                                                                                                          
#> [79] "Other outputs:"                                                                                                                                            
#> [80] "  --read-ends          Print counts of read starts/ends, if --min-unique-qual is set"                                                                      
#> [81] "                       then only the alignments that pass that filter will be counted here"                                                                
#> [82] "                       Writes to 2 TSV files: <prefix>.starts.tsv, <prefix>.ends.tsv"                                                                      
#> [83] "  --frag-dist          Print fragment length distribution across the genome"                                                                               
#> [84] "                       Writes to a TSV file <prefix>.frags.tsv"                                                                                            
#> [85] "  --echo-sam           Print a SAM record for each aligned read"                                                                                           
#> [86] "  --ends               Report end coordinate for each read (useful for debugging)"                                                                         
#> [87] "  --test-polya         Lower Poly-A filter minimums for testing (only useful for debugging/testing)"                                                       
#> [88] ""                                                                                                                                                          
#> [89] ""                                                                                                                                                          
megadepth_cmd("--help")
